metadata.title: CVE-2020-15436 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in fs/block_dev.c in the Linux kernel before5.8 allows local users to gain privileges or cause a denial of service byleveraging improper access to a certain error field.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15436` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-187-generic - 4.4.0-187.217
linux-image-4.4.0-187-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-187.217
linux-image-4.4.0-187-lowlatency - 4.4.0-187.217
linux-image-4.4.0-187-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-187.217
linux-image-4.4.0-187-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-187.217
linux-image-4.4.0-187-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-187.217
linux-image-4.4.0-187-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-187.217
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-187-generic - 4.4.0-187.217
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-187-lowlatency - 4.4.0-187.217
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-115-generic - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-115-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-115-lowlatency - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-115-generic - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-115-lowlatency - 4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1078-kvm - 4.4.0-1078.85
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1112-aws - 4.4.0-1112.124
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1080-aws - 4.15.0-1080.84~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1093-azure - 4.15.0-1093.103~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1081-gcp - 4.15.0-1081.92~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1051-oracle - 4.15.0-1051.55~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1137-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1137.146
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-187.217').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1078.85').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1112.124').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1080.84~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1093.103~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1081.92~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1051.55~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1137.146').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1141.149').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1044.49').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
